findings.title: Incorrect Accounting in VotingEscrowV3:_receiveCrossChain()
findings.description: The `_receiveCrossChain()` function updates the calling user’s lock balance and unlocking timestamp instead of the given account’s.

findings.title: Revisited Tranche Mint/Burn/Transfer/Approval Logic in FundV4
findings.description: The current implementation of mint/burn functions in FundV4 contract aims to improve gas efficiency but has a potential issue with balance refresh logic, which may lead to incorrect token balances.

findings.title: Improved Event Generation in BatchKeeperHelperBase
findings.description: Events may only be emitted when the requested operation is successful, and it's recommended to properly emit the AllowlistAdded/AllowlistRemoved event when there is a change in the _allowlist.

findings.title: Piggybacking startWeek in ChessScheduleRelayer::crossChainMint()
findings.description: The current logic may be enhanced to piggyback the week-related information for new emission in cross-chain mint operation, removing the implicit assumption of timely cross-chain transfers with sufficient liquidity reserve.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the `Tranchess` protocol, there is a privileged `owner` account that plays a critical role in governing and regulating the protocol- wide operations.
